channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2023110980
item.description:
Report X-2023110980

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet at top, inner material also wet. 1 of 4 gallon bottles of alcohol leaking from lid. Small puncture at top of lid causing release. Unable to be returned to original sealed condition. DescribePack: Pin sized puncture to top of plastic lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from sortation and placed in lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110481
item.description:
Report X-2023110481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking upon unload attempt. Put in tote and sent to QA for inspection. Upon opening box, cans were not facing same orientation. The cans were all dented or smashed in some fashion. The single can leaking is so severely dented that both the protective o-ring and the lid came up, allowing contents to leak out partially. DescribePack: 1 ince DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: put in tote until QA could inspect

item.title: Report E-2023110297
item.description:
Report E-2023110297

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: NORTH LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 55-gallon metal drum of regulated UN1219 "Isopropanol" was punctured by forklift. No drains or waterways were impacted. A contractor was called to assist in the cleanup of material.

item.title: Report E-2023110137
item.description:
Report E-2023110137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: NORTH LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Polyester Sealer "Alcea 5992/MS00" (UN1263) were released from (1) 6.6-gallon metal paint can due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the pallet only. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal personnel and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 10 gallon DM contains (1) 6.6 gallon DM of product was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
